intro: Ctenium schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African ctenium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a strong, spicy odor when crushed. Ctenium schweinfurthii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, open habitats.
